document_title: Acute liver failure: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Acute liver failure appears with many diverse symptoms. Some easily recognizable signs include:
Cerebral edema: Cerebral edema can lead to signs of increased endoscopic pressure (hypertension, bradycardia, papilledema...).; Jaundice: This sign is common but not always present.; Ascites: Acute liver failure that appears with abdominal pain is likely to form hepatic vein thrombosis and develop rapidly.; Right lower quadrant pain; Loss of prehepatic opaque area: liver atrophy if due to extensive necrosis of liver cells; Vomiting blood or passing black stools: Caused by upper gastrointestinal bleeding; In severe cases, consciousness disorders may occur: pre-coma confusion and coma
Complete acute liver failure can develop rapidly even in a healthy person, even becoming life-threatening. Therefore, when the body begins to show suspicious signs or unusual changes in mental state, behavior... the patient should immediately contact a doctor for timely examination and treatment.
